title: From foldables to fresh Macs: 5 Apple’s biggest products tipped for 2026
snippet: Apple is reportedly gearing up for a major 2026 lineup refresh, with a new Studio Display, redesigned MacBook Pro, its first foldable iPhone, a smart home hub and a more affordable MacBook, signalling one of the company’s most ambitious years yet.

title: Apple's iPhone 16 is the bestseller in a sea of budget smartphones in India
snippet: The iPhone 16 series sold 6.5 million units in the first 11 months of 2025 against 4.7 million of second-laed Y29 5G from BBK Electronics-backed Vivo. Even the iPhone 15 ranked among the five top-selling devices in the country.

title: From iPhone Air to Galaxy Z tri-fold and Ray-Ban Display: Check out the biggest tech launches of 2025
snippet: The year 2025 marked major tech advancements with Apple's iPhone Air, Samsung's Trifold, and the resurgence of compact phones. Meta upgraded Ray-Ban glasses with a high-resolution display and Neural Band control, showcasing a glimpse into the future of technology.

title: Best phones under  ₹25,000 you can buy before the New Year: OnePlus Nord CE 5, Realme P3 Ultra and more
snippet: For those seeking phones under  ₹25,000 in 2025, options like OnePlus Nord CE 5, Infinix GT 30 Pro, Poco X7 Pro, Realme P3 Ultra, and Motorola Edge 50 Pro stand out for their performance and features.

title: OnePlus 12 gets a sweet deal ahead of New Year, available for under  ₹50,000: Should you buy?
snippet: The OnePlus 12 is now priced at  ₹47,990 on Amazon, down from its launch price of  ₹64,999. It features a large LTPO AMOLED display, powerful Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor, and triple camera setup, making it a viable choice for budget-conscious buyers seeking premium features.

title: Is Instagram back online after outage? Here's what we know so far
snippet: Instagram experienced errors for some users, peaking at 4:10 AM EST with over 180 complaints. Issues included app access and login problems. The situation improved quickly, with users reporting restored access.

title: AI unicorn Fractal said to begin book-building for  ₹4,900 cr IPO next week
snippet: Following strong investor interest during recent roadshows, the TPG-backed firm plans to file updated draft papers by mid-January 2026.

title: iPhone 16e drops below  ₹50,000 during Vijay Sales Apple Days: should you buy?
snippet: During Vijay Sales Apple Days, the iPhone 16e is available for an effective price of  ₹46,990 after discounts. It features a 6.1-inch OLED display, A18 chip, and a single 48MP camera.&nbsp;

title: Apple’s first foldable iPhone leaks suggest book-style design and premium features: All you need to know
snippet: Apple’s first foldable iPhone is taking shape, with new leaks revealing a book-style design, near-invisible crease, powerful A20 Pro chip and premium build. The device could mark a major leap in Apple’s foldable ambitions.

title: Instagram down: Meta-owned platform faces login and app related issues for hundreds of users
snippet: Many users are facing issues with Meta's social media platform, according to Downdetector. This story is still developing.

title: TCS reboot on to become ready for AI-led future: COO Aarthi Subramanian
snippet: Tata Consultancy Services is preparing for an AI-driven future with a major internal and market reset. The company is shifting from AI pilots to scaled deployments focused on return on investment. TCS aims to become the world's largest AI-led technology services company.

title: India's tech M&As on a three-year high with deal value touching $29 billion
snippet: This surge is fueled by companies consolidating to gain scale amidst slowing organic growth. Experts anticipate continued momentum in 2026, with a focus on innovation and managed offerings.

title: Fabless chip companies eye surveillance market play via edge-AI silicon
snippet: Indian startups are designing advanced chips for video surveillance. These chips will process artificial intelligence locally on devices. title: Ola Electric’s market share halves in 2025 as legacy players tighten grip
snippet: The year 2025 marked a pivotal shift in India's electric two-wheeler market. After losing over half its market share, Ola Electric stepped down as market leader, with TVS Motor rising to take its place. Bajaj Auto thrived during this period, and Ather Energy alongside Hero MotoCorp proved their mett

title: Zepto’s IPO set to put quick-commerce giants under market scrutiny
snippet: The quick commerce sectoris set for sharper scrutiny given its high cash burn and aggressive expansion plans, experts say. title: Eight ways AI affected pop culture in 2025
snippet: Artificial intelligence made a significant impact on pop culture in 2025. AI-generated music topped charts, and films used AI for accent enhancement. Classic movies were reimagined with AI, and podcast hosts cloned their voices. Deceased celebrities appeared in AI-generated videos, sparking debate.

title: From AI to chips, Big Tech is getting what it wants from Trump
snippet: President Trump's administration has taken a tech-friendly approach, countering earlier commitments to regulate the industry. The relaxation of export limits on AI chips has paved the way for major tech companies to thrive, driving up their stock prices and raising cryptocurrency valuations.

title: Louis Gerstner, CEO credited with turning around IBM, dies at 83
snippet: Gerstner’s nine-year tenure as chairman and CEO of the company known as “Big Blue” is often used as a case study in corporate leadership.

title: Groundwork started for data protection board; online office software ready: IT Secretary Krishnan
snippet: The establishment of the Data Protection Board is on the fast track, with the government diligently paving the way for its formation. Procedures for member selection are in motion, and the digital tools needed for a seamless online operation are already in place.

title: AI start-ups amass record $150bn funding cushion as bubble fears mount

snippet: It’s getting harder to beat the heat. During the summer of 2025, heat waves knocked out power grids in North America, Europe, and the Middle East. title: Meet the man hunting the spies in your smartphone
snippet: In April 2025, Ronald Deibert left all electronic devices at home in Toronto and boarded a plane. When he landed in Illinois, he took a taxi to a mall and headed directly to the Apple Store to purchase a new laptop and iPhone. title: Four bright spots in climate news in 2025
snippet: Climate news hasn’t been great in 2025. Global greenhouse-gas emissions hit record highs (again). This year is set to be either the second or third warmest on record. snippet: At first glance, it looks like the start of a human pregnancy: A ball-shaped embryo presses gently into the receptive lining of the uterus and then grips tight, burrowing in as the first tendrils of a future placenta appear.  This is implantation—the moment that pregnancy officially begins. title: Welcome to Kenya’s Great Carbon Valley: a bold new gamble to fight climate change
snippet: The earth around Lake Naivasha, a shallow freshwater basin in south-central Kenya, does not seem to want to lie still.  Ash from nearby Mount Longonot, which erupted as recently as the 1860s, remains in the ground. title: This company is developing gene therapies for muscle growth, erectile dysfunction, and “radical longevity”
snippet: At some point next month, a handful of volunteers will be injected with two experimental gene therapies as part of an unusual clinical trial.
